txt.en:
'My friend, I have a peculiar task to ask of you....

'If you would humour me, I would ask that you collect phials of ichor from the many creatures of Lhingris. Spiders, gredbyg, crawlers, and even the carrion-flies are all of interest to me.

'I have grown more unsettled the deeper we pass into these lands, and I wish to examine the ichor of its creatures more closely.

'Return to me when you have gathered as much as you can bear!'
Legolas can be found beside the road above the swamps of Dath Nethryn.\n\nYou have gathered a great deal of ichor from the creatures of Lhingris and should now return to Legolas.
Deliver the phials of ichor to Legolas near Dath Nethryn
After exploring much of Lhingris, Legolas has become unnerved by similarities he has noticed in the many creatures and insects of the Ephel DÃºath.
Ichor can be harvested from various creatures in Lhingris.\n\nLegolas has asked you to gather ichor from the many insects and spiders of Lhingris.

'Ah, that will do. Thank you, my friend.'

Legolas begins to inspect each phial of ichor you recovered and does so for some time. All of a sudden, a wave of horror washes over his face.

'[placeholder]... this... this cannot be!

'Each phial of ichor you have collected is of the same source... they are all of Shelob's brood! Every single spider and every single insect in Lhingris is another of her twisted children!

'Lhingris itself writhes with her essence!'
